title: "Teaching Bayes and MathStats"

This website contains teaching materials for Bayesian analysis (APSTA-GE 2123) course and MathStats bootcamp, both taught at NYU. If you find any errors, please email me at eric.novik@nyu.edu.


```{r}
#| echo: false
library(plotly)

mu <- c(1, 0.5)
x <- seq(0, 10, len = 50)
y <- mu[1] + mu[2] * x + rnorm(50)

alpha <- seq(-2, 4, 0.1)
beta <- seq(-2.5, 3.5, 0.1)
sigma <- matrix(c(2,-1,-1, 2), nrow = 2)
f <- function(x, y) mvtnorm::dmvnorm(cbind(x, y), mu, sigma)
lik <- outer(alpha, beta, f)
p <- plot_ly(x = ~alpha, y = ~beta, z = ~lik)
p <- p %>% add_surface() %>% layout(title = 'Normal Likelihood', 
                                        plot_bgcolor = "#f0f1eb",
                                        paper_bgcolor = "#f0f1eb")
print(p)
```
